Michael
I guess you used the same workspace in 3.3 amd 3.2.1. Fix is trivial and I will provide a fix for 3.2.2.

Yes - I have two eclipse configs installed, one 3.2.1 and one 3.3M3 (because some plugins I use don't work with 3.3M3, yet) and I am indeed using the same workspace for both.

Michael

Note that 3.3 is allowed to upgrade the workspace so that 3.2 might loose settings. Of course we try to minimize this and of course it should always be handled gracefully. The bug I fixed in 3.2.2 was that the filter restore code was not prepared for unknown formats.

Verified in M20070112-1200.

> Of course we try to minimize this and of course it should always be
>handled gracefully.
NOTE: This is not true. Using an old build to start a workspace that was started with a newer version can lead to major problems and is not supported as outlined by the compatibility section of the 3.3 plan:

"A workspace created (or opened) by a product based on Eclipse 3.3 will be unusable with a product based an earlier version of Eclipse. Visible metadata files created (or overwritten) by Eclipse 3.3 will generally be unusable with earlier versions of Eclipse."
